article_title: Jury Finds Two Polygamous Towns Violated Nonbelievers Rights
article_text:
PHOENIX—Two polygamous towns in Arizona and Utah violated the constitutional rights of nonbelievers by denying them basic services such as police protection, building permits and water hookups, a jury said Monday.

The civil rights trial marks one of boldest efforts by the government to confront what critics have long said was a corrupt regime in Colorado City, Ariz., and Hildale, Utah. The towns were accused of doing the bidding of...
